text.tspan: S
W
STELLA
WALKER
3995 Emma Street, Huntsville, AL 35801, 256-520-3085, swalker@live.com

svg.text: Experienced Physicist with 7 years of applied research in astronomy and near-earth object tracking as part of
commercial space efforts. Excellent technologist with incessant curiosity and desire to discover new elements of
planetary systems. Successful grant writer with excellent record of winning critical funding for further research.
AeroD Industries | NASA Marshall Space Flight Center | Huntsville, AL

text.tspan: Assisted Meteoroid Environment Office staff in defining meteoroid environment and risk factors in relation to spacecraft design.
Delivered rapid analysis of skyfall events and analyzed instrument data collected on meteors, trajectories, origins and characteristics.
Modeled meteor showers and summarized events for presentation to NASA and contracted commercial organizations.
Applied skills in Python, C++, Mathematica and MATLAB to rapid modeling of events for analysis, investigation and reporting.

svg.text: The University of Arizona | Tucson, AZ

text.tspan: Conceptualized and implemented improved data tracking and analysis methods for application to mapping of Kuyper Belt objects.
Authored 23 winning grant applications to secure over $1.5M in funding across 5 years for progressive research into outer planetary system objects.
Managed team of 3 graduate assistants and 4 undergraduate interns on variety of astrological research projects.
Interpreted and recorded data gathered from multiple sources and evaluated results for anomalies.
Master of Science – Astronomy
University of California, Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
Thesis: Exploring Cosmic Micro Wavelengths using high resolution retrofit of camera at Roberts Heil Spectrograph
Bachelor of Science – Physics
Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA
Rhea Seddon Special Service Award (2014)
National Young Astronomer Award (2013)
Horkheimer/Smith Youth Service Award (2010)
